title: Teacher Competency Enhancement Program Based on Situated and Spiral Learning for Digital Literacy Development

context.prior_knowledge: Core science curriculum knowledge and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Provides AR-based situated learning and progressive deepening experiences for pre-/in-service secondary teachers to effectively instruct digital literacy in science classes.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically collect, classify, and manage various digital information (oral, text, images, data visualizations) required in science classes.
Learners can effectively communicate and exchange feedback with peer teachers during digital content production using online collaboration tools.

Learners can creatively design digital educational content that implements science concepts (e.g., molecular structures, celestial motion) through multimodal, interactive, and context-based representations using AR technology.
Learners can establish systematic criteria to evaluate the pedagogical efficacy and technical completeness of digital outputs and propose problem-solving solutions.

resources: Multimodal resource templates linked to science curriculum

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
